channel.title: Edit level 120 max to all skills?
channel.description:
Right now if you set the max to 120 all skills, you get a lot of 120/99, but 120/120 dung.
And I presume it's client sided because the extra 21 levels for dung are coded into the client so that it can track the exp for leveling and whatnot.
So, how can I make it so every skill can be maxed to 120?
Ok, so I need the interface ids for each of the skills and also how do I make the leveling orbs to show up on the screen after 99 for each skill because right now only dung shows after 99. And also when you hover over the skill it shows the remaining and next level values for dung after 99 but other skills after 99 its gone, so I need to add it manually.

item.title: Edit level 120 max to all skills?
item.dc:creator: @Flame3 John
item.description:
@Flame3 wrote:

If you’re looking for help from people that are willing to give you their time then replying in a considerate manner would be in your best interest. I’ll be removing any further replies that aren’t helpful, keep it to the topic or don’t post.

Read full topic

item.title: Edit level 120 max to all skills?
item.dc:creator: @pure2ownage Pure_
item.description:
@pure2ownage wrote:

[quote=“winK, post:24, topic:541073”]You’re a sore kid. Delirium.

317 with dungeoneering, lololo. Did 317 have xp till level built-in, I’m pretty sure that’s what I said. Ofc you can add to any, you can copy it from a 508+ server/client, convert it into a 317. You can add anything to anything if you know how. Good point bro. Your logic and attention to detail is riddled with holes like an anthill, bro, every post you’ve made so far. Take a break.

I posted in both sections, the client section actually didn’t get any replies. I posted in server section as well, because like I established, I wasn’t completely sure. Obviously then you ask both. I stated in the OP that I had a feeling it might be client-sided. But each and every one of you insisted there was no possibility, even the slightest, that it was client-sided. So, I guess that’s why this server help post got so many replies, because no one believed it was client-sided, lmao.

Oh the arrogance, how people think they are all-superior, Godless, bastards, when that is their greatest inferiority.[/quote]That array stores the values which are received from the server.

Read full topic

item.title: Edit level 120 max to all skills?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

winK:

Linking me stuff to do with 317s when I’m working on a 718 doesn’t help much. I don’t want to force anything. It wouldn’t display the XP remaining, no one would know when they’re almost the next level after 99 unless they’ve memorized all the level experiences.

You didn’t tell us you were working with a 718. So I assumed 317 and went from there. Maybe you should learn how to post a better topic to receive better help.

[quote=“winK, post:18, topic:541073”]This is what I’m talking about if you don’t understand. I’m pretty sure pre-508 server did not have this, because the client didn’t support showing xp till level in the Skills tab:
[/quote]
Wrong, so wrong. Any server could “support showing xp till level in the Skills tab”. and I mean ANY. It’s just sending another line of text, or you could edit the client script for it to do the math for you.

winK:

I just went on Rune-Server and found it it is client sided.

Oh, so you were asking in the wrong section from the beginning. Good going.

Read full topic

item.title: Edit level 120 max to all skills?
item.dc:creator: @winK winK
item.description:
@winK wrote:

I just went on Rune-Server and found it it is client sided.

[code]CLIENT SIDED
In Class368.java find
Code:

public static int[] anIntArray4002 = { 99, 99, 99, 99, 99, 99, 99, 99, 99, 99, 99, 99, 99, 99, 99, 99, 99, 99, 99, 99, 99, 99, 99, 99, 120 };

For the purpose of this tutorial, I am making all 120, so replace with this
Code:

public static int[] anIntArray4002 = { 120, 120, 120, 120, 120, 120, 120, 120, 120, 120, 120, 120, 120, 120, 120, 120, 120, 120, 120, 120, 120, 120, 120, 120, 120 };

[/code]

Read full topic
item.source: Edit level 120 max to all skills?

item.title: Edit level 120 max to all skills?
item.dc:creator: @Dan0194 Dan0194
item.description:
@Dan0194 wrote:

[quote=“winK, post:18, topic:541073”]Yep, but nowhere does it have anything to do with sending strings to the Skills tab. I think Pure_ is mistaken that you’re right. Once again, just picking the opposite side because of my attitude.

Makes no sense that it’s in the server to be quite honest. Try to think about it, I’ve already pointed this out a million times, but the client itself recognizes when Dungeoneering is 100+ it still shows the XP remaining, while other skills at 99 it automatically no longer shows it. So in the client, or some kind of client script, is communicating with the server, and is changing the interface numbers automatically, and capping it for all skills except Dungeoneering, at 99, and Dung at 120, and tells the client to show the XP remaining until max level recognizable by the client, which is only 99 except for Dungeoneering.

I think this community is full of people that have coding experience limited to the lower revisions that Moparscape started from. But the newer revisions have changed their way of functioning, and it no longer allows the client to display values higher than what it’s been scripted to show because it has to do with the level XP left for each specific skill: It has to automatically detect when they level up, by having built-in values for the XP remaining before next level. That is why if you search for the string “XP remaining”, you don’t find anything, because that string must be somewhere else besides the server…

This is what I’m talking about if you don’t understand. I’m pretty sure pre-508 server did not have this, because the client didn’t support showing xp till level in the Skills tab:

But I could be wrong. If you guys can find out where the server calls for each of the values when you hover over a skill, that is probably where the cap for each skill is for 99 and dung 120.[/quote]
I didn’t even read that whole thing you just said but i’m telling you now that 718’s have the interface text editor packet on them. I just don’'t know the code for it because you are using a 718. I looked for you and it may be this.

player.getPackets().sendIComponentText(INTERFACEID, LINE, TEXT);

Read full topic

@winK wrote:

Okay, so if they’re just not called and I need to replace them, I need to find the interface ids for them like I said, but I don’t know where to look because nothing’s been declared and I don’t have a interface editor for 718 cache. Anyone know the ids for each skill for in the skill tab? The id for where it shows the xp remaining, etc? So I just got to force it to show that line even at 99 until 120 for all skills basically. If you’re right and I just have to force each line to appear after 99, then I should be able to get it to display without editing the cache I guess. That must be where that information is stored the default values shown before you replace it.

item.dc:creator: @winK winK
item.description:
@winK wrote:

Yep, but nowhere does it have anything to do with sending strings to the Skills tab. I think Pure_ is mistaken that you’re right. Once again, just picking the opposite side because of my attitude.

Makes no sense that it’s in the server to be quite honest. Try to think about it, I’ve already pointed this out a million times, but the client itself recognizes when Dungeoneering is 100+ it still shows the XP remaining, while other skills at 99 it automatically no longer shows it. So in the client, or some kind of client script, is communicating with the server, and is changing the interface numbers automatically, and capping it for all skills except Dungeoneering, at 99, and Dung at 120, and tells the client to show the XP remaining until max level recognizable by the client, which is only 99 except for Dungeoneering.

I think this community is full of people that have coding experience limited to the lower revisions that Moparscape started from. But the newer revisions have changed their way of functioning, and it no longer allows the client to display values higher than what it’s been scripted to show because it has to do with the level XP left for each specific skill: It has to automatically detect when they level up, by having built-in values for the XP remaining before next level. That is why if you search for the string “XP remaining”, you don’t find anything, because that string must be somewhere else besides the server…

This is what I’m talking about if you don’t understand. I’m pretty sure pre-508 server did not have this, because the client didn’t support showing xp till level in the Skills tab:

But I could be wrong. If you guys can find out where the server calls for each of the values when you hover over a skill, that is probably where the cap for each skill is for 99 and dung 120.

@Dan0194 wrote:

[quote=“winK, post:16, topic:541073”]Okay, so there must be somewhere in the server that actually sends the interface values to the Skills Tab for each max level dependent on the level of that skill. Then how come it is capped at 99 except Dungeoneering? When I search for “99” in my whole workspace, I come up with nothing that has to do with sending values to the Skills Tab.

And secondly, what about the XP tracker? When you hover over a skill in your Skills Tab, all skills except Dung don’t have XP remaining anymore after level 99, I need every skill to have that after 99 once they can level past 99…

And I can’t find an Interface Editor for 718 cache… So I can’t figure out what each skill’s interface ID is in the Skills tab.[/quote]

And I initially posted in server help because I wasn’t sure. I’ve made the same post in client help now. item.source: Edit level 120 max to all skills?

item.title: Edit level 120 max to all skills?
item.dc:creator: @winK winK
item.description:
@winK wrote:

Linking me stuff to do with 317s when I’m working on a 718 doesn’t help much. I don’t want to force anything. It wouldn’t display the XP remaining, no one would know when they’re almost the next level after 99 unless they’ve memorized all the level experiences.

Well, at least you’re at least acknowledging it has the potential to be clientsided, or at least a client script like you described. Now if I can just figure out how to edit it.

Yes, I did see that script called. And I wondered what it was. Could potentially be it. Though, that’s why I’m unsure since I cannot find out without knowing where to look.

And I initially posted in server help because I wasn’t sure. I’ve made the same post in client help now. Perhaps it was a mistake to put it here, everyone insists it’s server-sided, I just thought I would get some thought into it, perhaps I was wrong, but it seems like I’m not, it is indeed something other than server… I wasn’t sure at first, but when everyone came in claiming it’s server sided, then saying to look at places I’ve already looked and already patched to make all skills 120 max, but not in Skills Tab, now I am more convinced that it’s client related.

Unless DAn is right, which is possible. The problem is I cannot find where the strings for the levels are sent to the client for it to display the denominator in Skills Tab. Though, I don’t remember anywhere in the server files where it actually sends any strings/variables to the skills interface. I’m sure it’s like a client script that Sk8r is talking about, because you start out 1/1 everything by default, and it automatically changes it as it detects a level up, and it tracks your experience, probably client-sided/scripted.

But specifically, that location doesn’t seem to have anything to do with allowing it to display 120. Like I said, I already tried setting it to 120. Nothing. Secondly, take a look at the name of the actual declaration:
getWearingSkillRequiriments()

Does that sound like the Skills Tab to you? It seems like you have a knack for missing the actual meaningful aspects of code.

You’re just jumping from one thing to another, each time claiming it’s obviously that reason. When it’s not. I get it though, many people test by trial and error, but I’ve already tried all of those things.

Read full topic

item.source: Edit level 120 max to all skills?

item.title: Edit level 120 max to all skills?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Hey. You’re forgetting something. One thing that’s HUGE in clients. They’re called scripts.
See this code:

More specifically, this: clientScriptData.get(277);
That’s calling a script. What the script does, I personally don’t know since I’m not the one that put it there (Nor am I good with clients). So for all you know is your issue could be packed into one of the various scripts in your client, and we don’t even see it.

Also, if you’re so damn sure this is client sided then why are you asking in the Server Help section. It would make sense if you posted in the Client Help section so that someone that is good with clients may help you with your client sided error and then you could stop asking people that work with servers for help. Yes, it’s java, but a lot of the people in the server help section don’t work with clients, making it hard for us to actually help you with that.

An alternative to editing everything client sided, you could always force the text to show 100-120, using the Set Interface Text packet. This would be very messy and nasty, but is a solution for the time being.

Again, go to the client section for client help, server section for server.

Read full topic
item.source: Edit level 120 max to all skills?

item.title: Edit level 120 max to all skills?
item.dc:creator: @winK winK
item.description:
@winK wrote:

Here, let’s just make this simple, here are some pictures so it’s like preschool again, no need to read:

I’m not getting mad, I get told that a lot, I just try too hard to try and explain myself clearer, when people misunderstand and claim I am wrong. When some people like to pretend they’re right when they’re completely wrong.

First of all, I tried changing the line
skills.put(maxedSkill, getId() == 19709 ? 120 : 99);
to
skills.put(maxedSkill, 120);
and it still doesn’t display as 120/120. Like I said, it has nothing to do with the max level but rather it’s just for the itemdefinition item requirements (that’s where it comes from, ItemDefinition.java).

Secondly, the way I have it works perfectly fine, I don’t know what you’re talking about. You still level up to 120 like Dungeoneering. You go from 99-120, each level in between. Not straight to 120.

I am irritated because your attempts to help have not made sense logically, programming-wise. If you cannot understand the code you’re reading or don’t know about a higher revision server/client, don’t attempt to help, because you’re not doing anything but making it more confusing and making me have to type all this out to try and explain to you how you’re wrong. Unless you can find me another location where it actually makes dungeoneering able to have more than level 99 and still able to have XP Remaining until 120 client-sided display-wise.

For example, I have already searched my whole workspace for the string “XP remaining” written into the client in the Skills Tab when you hover over a skill, nothing comes up in the server files. But nothing comes up in the client source either, so perhaps it’s stored in the cache… I cannot know. And I do not see anyone that knows either.

Neither of those locations have anything to do with DISPLAYING 120/120 IN THE SKILLS TAB IN YOUR CLIENT. It merely allows your server to level your character to 120 all skills and the other has to do with your item requirements, but in the skills tab, the client is unable to display each skill 120/120, only dungeoneering, because dungoneering has it coded IN THE CLIENT, to display more xp remaining when hovering over the skill, all the way till 120. Like I tried to explain. Maybe repeating myself will make it clearer, although it shouldn’t, if you already read it the first time. But apparently not.

Here’s the rest of that code btw

[code] public HashMap<Integer, Integer> getWearingSkillRequiriments() {
if (clientScriptData == null)
return null;
if (itemRequiriments == null) {
HashMap<Integer, Integer> skills = new HashMap<Integer, Integer>();
for (int i = 0; i < 10; i++) {
Integer skill = (Integer) clientScriptData.get(749 + (i * 2));
if (skill != null) {
Integer level = (Integer) clientScriptData
.get(750 + (i * 2));
if (level != null)
skills.put(skill, level);
}
}
Integer maxedSkill = (Integer) clientScriptData.get(277);
if (maxedSkill != null)
// skills.put(maxedSkill, getId() == 19709 ? 120 : 99);
skills.put(maxedSkill, 120);
itemRequiriments = skills;
if (getId() == 7462)
itemRequiriments.put(Skills.DEFENCE, 40);
else if (name.equals(“Dragon defender”)) {
itemRequiriments.put(Skills.ATTACK, 60);
itemRequiriments.put(Skills.DEFENCE, 60);
}
}

	return itemRequiriments;
}[/code]

itemRequiriments = skills; -this is where it’s NOT for your skills tab level, but for your item requirements

In the end, I’m just tired of people that try and help, but act like they know more, insist that they’re right and I’m wrong, but cannot read the code I describe, claims that changing the code I showed would actually fix it when I already tried changing it to simply 120 instead of 99. Insist it’s impossible to be client-sided. That’s what I get irritated by, not that you’re trying to help, I appreciate all help, just don’t treat me like a retard and call what I said retarded, when nothing you’ve said verifies either.

Maybe you haven’t seen a client that limits your max level, but the problem is, it doesn’t limit your max level, the CLIENT CANNOT DISPLAY IT. I in fact remember this happening since 317s.

I remember setting the max skills level 255, and it would display 255/99 just like now (this may be selective memory, it may be that 317-474 clients do do it the way you describe, which allows you 255/255 for example).

In my old 508 server, same thing. So, you must not have much experience with 508+ servers in general, to claim what you’re claiming. Show me one 508+ server where you can successfully set your levels to x/x > 99, like your supposed code of if(xp > integer). I can’t find such a thing, and I’ve never seen that code used in a server before, except those retard servers with one client.java and everything jammed inside it, maybe those (317-474?).

And I’ve also already been told long before, that the only reason people cannot set skills above 99 max, is exactly what I am saying, because it’s client-sided. I’m not just saying this out of my own knowledge, others have said the same thing.

And I love how Pure_ acts like he knows everything, but doesn’t do a thing to actually hint and help me. Probably just jumping on the bandwagon.

Another thing to add, the total level also doesn’t go above the max: when you hit 99 all skills and 120 dung, you’re total 2497 or something. While if you had 120/120 all skills it would be 3000 total exact. It only displays 2497 because the client can only display the values of 99 for each skills except dungeoneering, therefore the total level is also still the original 99 skills besides dung. While with my stats checker in a separate interface, shows that the server actually recognizes my total level is in fact 3000, when 120/99 all skills, because I’m actually 120/120, the client just cannot display it.

So let’s get pass this whole idea that it’s a server, unless someone with enough knowledge of 508+ clients can show exactly where in the server files you can do what I’m talking about. Otherwise we should be checking the client… finally.

Read full topic
item.source: Edit level 120 max to all skills?

item.title: Edit level 120 max to all skills?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“winK, post:9, topic:541073”]Then where does it get the experience for each level in the tracker in your skills tab? Isn’t that where I need to look? Not the getLevelForXp.

I found this:

Integer maxedSkill = (Integer) clientScriptData.get(277); if (maxedSkill != null) skills.put(maxedSkill, getId() == 19709 ? 120 : 99);

But it’s not it, it has to do with the item requirements.

I cannot think of where to look to allow all skills to DISPLAY IN THE SKILLS TAB AS 120/120.
EVEN THOUGH MY MAX LEVEL IS 120 EVERY SKILL, IT SHOWS 120/99 IN THE SKILLS TAB.

My server recognizes that my skills are all level 120, and if you gain enough XP in a skill besides dungeoneering, you can still level to 120, but each time it just shows 100…101…102…103…/99, AND you cannot see how much XP IS REMAINING TILL NEXT LEVEL, WHILE DUNGEONEERING YOU CAN.

And I think all of you guys are completely mistaken when I say that it cannot be 120/120, I mean it doesn’t display in the Skills Tab as 120/120. Not that I cannot get my all skills to level up to 120. That specifically is client-sided is what I’m saying. I know I can set the maximum level to be 120, and I already have. Like I showed in my code, that makes all my skills go up to 120.

The problem is: In the SKILLS TAB, it only shows 120/99, because the client doesn’t know how to display any higher values than 99 for all the skills besides dungeoneering, because it has the tracker setup so when you level to max it doesn’t show the next level anymore, well, dungeoneering can go up to 120 before it does that, and every skill 100+ displays the xp remaining before level, but other skills don’t display that. Once it hits 99 then it removes the remaining xp till level…

So, that specifically, the displaying of the client, in the SKILLS TAB, showing your SKILLS LEVELS, only displays x/99 max for all skills except dungeoneering. Is that understandable?[/quote]
Listen.
First off, don’t get irritated or mad at us for trying to help. All of us are helping based off past experience with these servers. I haven’t seen a single client that limited your max level. Why they would is just plain retarded.

Second, why not remove this:

if (maxedSkill != null) skills.put(maxedSkill, getId() == 19709 ? 120 : 99);
That’s obviously the code that is preventing your levels to get to above 99.

Third:

[quote=“winK, post:5, topic:541073”]Awesome, been looking for that, makes sense.

Searched for it, came up with nothing… As you can see this is what I’ve done:

public int getLevelForXp(int skill) { double exp = xp[skill]; int points = 0; int output = 0; for (int lvl = 1; lvl <= (player.getPrestigeLevel() > 6 ? 120 : skill == DUNGEONEERING ? 120 : 99); lvl++) { points += Math.floor(lvl + 300.0 * Math.pow(2.0, lvl / 7.0)); output = (int) Math.floor(points / 4); if ((output - 1) >= exp) { return lvl; } } return player.getPrestigeLevel() > 6 ? 120 : skill == DUNGEONEERING ? 120 : 99; }

Nowhere does it say the exp > i… doesn’t really make sense either now that I think about it. Why would they set each xp for each level when it’s automatic? The client itself recognizes when there’s how much xp left for every level without having to program it into the server.[/quote]
This part, I don’t understand why you did:

This doesn’t check if the exp is at the right variable. That way making it possible that someone with more than 13m exp and a prestige level of greater than 6 will automatically have 120.
Remember, the getLevelForXP formula for all levels to 120.

Read full topic
item.source: Edit level 120 max to all skills?

item.title: Edit level 120 max to all skills?
item.dc:creator: @winK winK
item.description:
@winK wrote:

Then where does it get the experience for each level in the tracker in your skills tab? Isn’t that where I need to look? Not the getLevelForXp.

I found this:

Integer maxedSkill = (Integer) clientScriptData.get(277); if (maxedSkill != null) skills.put(maxedSkill, getId() == 19709 ? 120 : 99);

But it’s not it, it has to do with the item requirements.

I cannot think of where to look to allow all skills to DISPLAY IN THE SKILLS TAB AS 120/120.
EVEN THOUGH MY MAX LEVEL IS 120 EVERY SKILL, IT SHOWS 120/99 IN THE SKILLS TAB.

My server recognizes that my skills are all level 120, and if you gain enough XP in a skill besides dungeoneering, you can still level to 120, but each time it just shows 100…101…102…103…/99, AND you cannot see how much XP IS REMAINING TILL NEXT LEVEL, WHILE DUNGEONEERING YOU CAN.

And I think all of you guys are completely mistaken when I say that it cannot be 120/120, I mean it doesn’t display in the Skills Tab as 120/120. Not that I cannot get my all skills to level up to 120. That specifically is client-sided is what I’m saying. I know I can set the maximum level to be 120, and I already have. Like I showed in my code, that makes all my skills go up to 120.

The problem is: In the SKILLS TAB, it only shows 120/99, because the client doesn’t know how to display any higher values than 99 for all the skills besides dungeoneering, because it has the tracker setup so when you level to max it doesn’t show the next level anymore, well, dungeoneering can go up to 120 before it does that, and every skill 100+ displays the xp remaining before level, but other skills don’t display that. Once it hits 99 then it removes the remaining xp till level…

So, that specifically, the displaying of the client, in the SKILLS TAB, showing your SKILLS LEVELS, only displays x/99 max for all skills except dungeoneering. Is that understandable?

Read full topic

Like I said, I am right. Unless you can find me another location where it actually states each level for each level after 99 for Dungeoneering. It must be client-sided otherwise. item.title: Edit level 120 max to all skills?
item.dc:creator: @Bl3nd Bl3nd
item.description:
@Bl3nd wrote:

[quote=“winK, post:5, topic:541073”]Awesome, been looking for that, makes sense.

Searched for it, came up with nothing… As you can see this is what I’ve done:

public int getLevelForXp(int skill) { double exp = xp[skill]; int points = 0; int output = 0; for (int lvl = 1; lvl <= (player.getPrestigeLevel() > 6 ? 120 : skill == DUNGEONEERING ? 120 : [b]120[/b]); lvl++) { points += Math.floor(lvl + 300.0 * Math.pow(2.0, lvl / 7.0)); output = (int) Math.floor(points / 4); if ((output - 1) >= exp) { return lvl; } } return player.getPrestigeLevel() > 6 ? 120 : skill == DUNGEONEERING ? 120 : [b]120[/b]; }

Nowhere does it say the exp > i… doesn’t really make sense either now that I think about it. Why would they set each xp for each level when it’s automatic? The client itself recognizes when there’s how much xp left for every level without having to program it into the server.[/quote]

Maybe this is how you’d go about it?

for (int lvl = 1; lvl <= (player.getPrestigeLevel() > 6 ? 120 : skill == DUNGEONEERING ? 120 : [b]120[/b]); lvl++) {
...
return player.getPrestigeLevel() > 6 ? 120 : skill == DUNGEONEERING ? 120 : [b]120[/b];

item.title: Edit level 120 max to all skills?
item.dc:creator: @winK winK
item.description:
@winK wrote:

Awesome, been looking for that, makes sense.

Searched for it, came up with nothing… As you can see this is what I’ve done:

public int getLevelForXp(int skill) { double exp = xp[skill]; int points = 0; int output = 0; for (int lvl = 1; lvl <= (player.getPrestigeLevel() > 6 ? 120 : skill == DUNGEONEERING ? 120 : 99); lvl++) { points += Math.floor(lvl + 300.0 * Math.pow(2.0, lvl / 7.0)); output = (int) Math.floor(points / 4); if ((output - 1) >= exp) { return lvl; } } return player.getPrestigeLevel() > 6 ? 120 : skill == DUNGEONEERING ? 120 : 99; }

Nowhere does it say the exp > i… doesn’t really make sense either now that I think about it. Why would they set each xp for each level when it’s automatic? The client itself recognizes when there’s how much xp left for every level without having to program it into the server.

item.title: Edit level 120 max to all skills?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“winK, post:3, topic:541073”]I’m not sure about that. I’m pretty sure I unlocked the get level for xp for all skills level 120. All that does is make it so you can level up to 120, but it doesn’t track any of it after 99, and when you level higher than 99 it’s x/99, as client-sided it won’t allow values higher than 99 since it’s not coded to track it that high. I’ll look again though.

I’ve changed the return value from the getlevelforxp to 120 for all skills, but I don’t think I have made the experience for all skills like dungeoneering. I’ll have to figure that out.[/quote]
It’s simple.
You know where it says something like

if(exp > 13034431) return 99;

Change that to

if(exp > 104273166)
return 120;

It’s literally the easiest edit ever.

Read full topic

I’ll look again though.

I’ve changed the return value from the getlevelforxp to 120 for all skills, but I don’t think I have made the experience for all skills like dungeoneering. I’ll have to figure that out.
